revised_title: Exploring the Evolution of "All-or-Nothing" Displays in Signaling Theory
tldr: The author presents a signaling model that incorporates perceptual error, which is often present in real signaling systems. The model reveals that the introduction of perceptual error can lead to the evolution of discrete, "all-or-nothing" signals. This research provides a strategic explanation for the typical intensity observed in many animal displays and can be applied to various instances of quality advertisement.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
